business.headline: Meta hires ChatGPT co-creator as chief scientist to lead new AI labMeta has appointed ChatGPT co-creator Shengjia Zhao as chief scientist of its new Superintelligence Lab, aiming to advance AGI and regain AI leadership after Llama 4's weak performance.

Explained: Why India-UK free trade agreement is a big deal for both nationsIndia and the United Kingdom have formally sealed a Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, a deal described as the "biggest, most economically significant trade deal that the UK has made since leaving the EU."

Not a shareholder, no coercion: Sunjay Kapur's firm counters mother's chargesThe clarification comes after it was reported that Rani Kapur had written a letter to delay the AGM and alleged that she was made to sign documents shortly after her son's death.

Remainers will choke on their cornflakes: British media hails India trade dealThe India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) or the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) seeks to enhance bilateral trade by around USD 34 billion annually, besides ensuring better market access.

FTAs with EU, US in talks, says Commerce Secretary after India-UK trade dealThe agreement now needs to pass through both houses of the British Parliament. A special committee will study it before giving final approval.

Everyone wants to be an influencer. But can it pay the bills?The creator economy in India is booming, but the economics remain shaky. What started as a hobby or side hustle for many is now a full-time hustle, and an increasingly competitive one.

Sensex ends 721 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; Bajaj Finance falls 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 721.08 points to 81,463.09 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 225.10 points to trade at 24,837.

Sunjay Kapur's mother alleges business coercion, attempt to 'usurp family legacy'Rani Kapur has publicly objected to what she calls an "inappropriate and premature" AGM, held during a period of deep mourning, and raised serious concerns over how decisions are being made in the aftermath.

This key agreement in UK trade deal will hugely benefit Indian firms, workersOne of the key parts of the India-UK trade deal is the introduction of the Double Contribution Convention (DCC), which is expected to help Indian professionals working in the UK by reducing their social security burden.

Filing ITR under old regime? Claim these 5 home loan tax benefits If you are sticking to the old tax regime this year, make sure you don't miss out on the big tax savings your home loan can offer. Here are five home loan benefits you must know for your ITR.

Who has to file ITR by when? All 2025 deadlines explainedFiling your ITR on time can save you from paying extra penalties. But not everyone has the same deadline this year. Here's a quick look at who must file by when for the 2025 cycle.

Sensex tumbles over 700 points: Why stock markets are in the red today The benchmark S&P BSE Sensex fell 624.64 points to 81,559.53 by 10:41 am, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 215.85 points to 24,846.25.

Explained: Why IEX share price gained 11% todayIEX stock opened at Rs 137.00 today, higher than the previous close of Rs 132.45. It climbed further to touch a high of Rs 149.45 in morning trade. As of 9:37 am, the share was trading at Rs 146.80, up 10.84%.

Explained: Why Bajaj Finance shares tumbled 6% despite strong Q1 resultsThe Bajaj Finance stock was down 5.42% at Rs 907 on the BSE at around 9:28 am, while Bajaj Finserv also fell nearly 5%. Bajaj Finance touched an intraday low of Rs 898.10, marking a 6.3% decline.

NSDL IPO: Check price band, GMP, key dates, issue size and moreThe IPO, a pure offer for sale, aims to raise Rs 4,011 crore. It will open for subscription on July 30 and close on August 1, with anchor bids starting a day earlier on July 29.

Sensex falls 300 points at opening, Nifty below 25,000; Bajaj Finance tanks 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 389.42 points to 81,794.75, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 133.70 points to 24,928.40 as of 9:25 am.

IEX stock: Indian Energy Exchange shares to be in focus today. Here's whyIEX shares fell sharply on Thursday, July 24. The stock dropped as much as 28% and touched a 52-week low of Rs 135.26 on the BSE.
Intel layoffs: 25,000 roles at risk as company braces for big reset, says reportIn a letter to employees, Intel's new CEO Lip-Bu Tan acknowledged the difficult period the company is going through.

Why Donald Trump doesn't want Google, Microsoft to hire IndiansSpeaking at an AI Summit in Washington on Wednesday, Donald Trump said American companies must now put national interest first, especially in the fast-growing field of artificial intelligence.

Kristin Cabot, Astronomer HR head, resigns after viral Coldplay kiss-cam scandalAstronomer's HR chief Kristin Cabot resigned days after being caught on a Coldplay kiss-cam with CEO Andy Byron, who also stepped down earlier amid the viral scandal and public backlash.

Billionaire behind your browser: Sundar Pichai's net worth crosses $1 billionAlphabet stock has returned around 120% to investors since 2023 and is now trading close to its all-time high. This has benefited top executives, including Sundar Pichai.

India-UK free trade deal: How the deal could boost bilateral tradeThe deal is expected to provide greater market access for Indian products and services, while UK companies, particularly in sectors like automobiles and medical equipment, will also benefit from reduced tariffs.

Why some purchases are priceless: Startup founder on spending and living wellWe often treat money decisions like maths problems, but this startup founder says some buys, like a family car or your own home, bring wealth you can't count.

PM Modi in UK for FTA: Cheaper scotch and cars on cardsPrime Minister Narendra Modi is in the UK for a meeting with the UK Prime Minister and is also expected to meet King Charles III, with the India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) being the main focus. This agreement is set to provide significant market access to Indian sectors like fisheries, textiles, gems, jewellery, and leather, with a potential market size of $5.2 billion in the UK for the fisheries sector alone.

Money matters, but joy matters more: Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta's mantra for lifeMany young earners feel constant pressure to save every rupee for the future. It's common to hear advice about building a fat retirement fund or aiming for the highest returns. But Radhika Gupta wants people to know that money is only useful if it also makes your present better.

Whisky, chocolates, cars: What gets cheaper for Indians after UK trade dealThe trade agreement was signed by India's Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and the UK's Secretary of State for Business and Trade, Jonathan Reynolds.

Sensex ends 542 points lower, Nifty below 25,100 as volatility weighs heavyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 542.47 points lower at 82,184.17, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 157.80 points to close at 25,062.10. Selling pressure was visible across sectors, with FMCG, IT, and financial stocks dragging the indices down.

Small shopkeepers are turning away from UPI paymentsAccording to the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), UPI saw over 14.04 billion transactions in June 2024. Yet, for many at the grassroots, the system seems too complex and risky to fully embrace.
ED raids hit Anil Ambani stocks: Reliance Power, Infra sink 5%Reliance Infrastructure has lost 9.37% in the past five trading sessions, Reliance Power has fallen by 7.41% during the same period.

Filed the wrong ITR form? Here's how to fix it to avoid penaltyMany taxpayers only spot mistakes after hitting 'Submit'. Filing the wrong form can snowball into bigger headaches later, from refund delays to unexpected penalties. But tax experts say you do have ways to set things right, provided you act quickly.

Sensex plunges 600 points. Why is the stock market down today?The S&P BSE Sensex dropped 592.85 points to 82,133.79 by 1:04 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 169.25 points to 25,050.65. All broader market indices were in the red as market sentiment weakened.

EPFO now on DigiLocker: See how it helps youThe government has been making several digital changes for EPFO members in the last few months. This new feature on DigiLocker is another step to make your provident fund details more accessible.

Loan, lies and bribery? Why Anil Ambani is facing ED heatMultiple agencies, including the National Housing Bank, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi), the National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA), and Bank of Baroda shared findings and inputs that contributed to the investigation.
India-UK FTA: What's on the table in landmark $34 billion deal?For Indian businesses, the FTA opens up wider access to British markets by slashing tariffs and easing compliance.

No penalty for missed income tax deadlines? Panel suggests in New Tax BillThe suggestions come from the Select Committee, which has studied the new Income Tax Bill, 2025. This new Bill is meant to replace the old Income Tax Act of 1961.

ED conducts raids on properties linked to Anil Ambani in MumbaiThe Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Thursday carried out searches at multiple locations in Mumbai connected to industrialist Anil Ambani's companies, days after the State Bank of India (SBI) classified Reliance Communications and Ambani himself as 'fraud'. While his personal residence wasn't searched, ED teams from Delhi and Mumbai targeted premises tied to Reliance Anil Ambani Group (RAAGA) companies in connection with an ongoing money laundering investigation.

IEX share price crashes 23% to hit 52-week low. What's behind the fall?IEX shares nosedived after CERC announced phased implementation of market coupling. The move aims to centralise price discovery, challenging IEX's dominance. Investors await clarity from the company's Q1FY26 results.

ED raids Anil Ambani-linked premises in Mumbai days after SBI's 'fraud' tagWhile Anil Ambani's personal residence was not part of the search operation, the ED teams from Delhi and Mumbai visited premises tied to some of his group companies.

NSDL IPO: Check key dates, issue size and other key detailsThe NSDL IPO will open on July 30 and close on August 1, offering 5.01 crore shares through an offer for sale by existing institutional shareholders.

entertainment.headline: Hari Hara Veera Mallu box office Day 2: Pawan Kalyan's film sees a huge dipPawan Kalyan's 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' saw a sharp decline at the box office on its second day, earning Rs 8 crore after an impressive Rs 47.50 crore opening.

Saiyaara box office Day 8: Mohit Suri film continues strong run, earns Rs 190 croreMohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' has been earning tremendous love from all quarters. The movie, starring debutant Ahaan Panday alongside Aneet Padda, earned Rs 190 crore in just eight days.

Actor Ruchi Gujjar files complaint against film producer over financial fraudActress Ruchi Gujjar has filed an FIR against producer Karan Singh Chauhan over a Rs 24 lakh fraud linked to a TV serial deal. She alleges misuse of funds and intimidation after demanding her money back.

After harassment claims, Tanushree Dutta says she is leading quiet, spiritual lifeActor Tanushree Dutta stated that she was overwhelmed with constant media requests for interviews. She had recently claimed about facing life threat at her home in Mumbai.

Shruti Haasan promises a brave new world as father Kamal Haasan joins Rajya SabhaActor Kamal Haasan was sworn in as Rajya Sabha MP in Delhi. His actor-daughter Shruti Haasan dedicated an emotional post to him, highlighting the personal side of his political milestone.

Did you know that Saiyaara's Ahaan Panday is a Blackpink fan?Ahaan Panday astonished fans with an unexpected K-pop revelation, naming BLACKPINK's Lisa as his favourite idol. The admission sent Indian K-pop enthusiasts into a frenzy. Read more here.
Suhana Khan, Agastya Nanda attend event in New York, singer Tesher joinsSuhana Khan and Agastya Nanda attended an event together in New York. Pictures of them partying have emerged online.

Mohit Suri's Saiyaara captures Gen Z's raw and real love storyMohit Suri's Saiyaara has become a cultural hit among Gen Z for its raw portrayal of young love. The film's focus on mental health and emotional depth sparks new conversations about romance and relationships.

Ed Sheeran loved Arijit's voice so much, he released a new version of SapphireSinger Ed Sheeran has expressed high praise for Arijit Singh in a detailed post, saying he loves his voice. Both versions of 'Sapphire', which feature intricate South Asian percussion, were produced by Ilya Salmanzadeh, Johnny McDaid, and Savan Kotecha.

Karan Johar on being isolated as a kid for being too feminine: Wasn't boy enoughKaran Johar opened up about his childhood struggles with being labelled as feminine. He recalled his challenges as a child in seeking acceptance and belonging from his peers.

S Line could just be the most genius K-Drama of 2025. Because sex and secrets!Lee Soo-hyuk's 'S Line' blends a provocative premise, sharp social commentary, and gripping mystery. In this week's K-Fix we will discuss why it is 2025's boldest K-drama yet.

Karan Johar regrets making OK Jaanu, says felt uncertain but ignored instinctsKaran Johar expressed regret over making 'OK Jaanu', admitting he ignored his instincts despite feeling uncertain about the remake. The film did not meet expectations, and Johar acknowledges this as a mistake he often makes, even as he prepares for his next production, 'Dhadak 2'.

All eyes on Bigg Boss 19 as makers officially begin countdown with bold logo'Bigg Boss 19' is all set to premiere this August on JioHotstar. Ahead of its premiere, the makers shared an exciting promo on July 23, to build the intrigue.

Is Saiyaara's title track copied from Jubin Nautiyal and One Direction?Fans believe that Saiyaara's title track is copied from songs by One Direction and Jubin Nautiyal. This follows speculation that the movie itself is a remake of the Korean film 'A Moment to Remember'.

Ayya The Lion of Tamil Nadu: PMK founder Ramadoss's biopic announced with posterDirector Cheran to helm the biopic 'Ayya - The Lion of Tamil Nadu', with Aari Arujunan in the lead role. The film will explore the life of PMK founder Ramadoss and the Vanniyar reservation agitation.

War 2 trailer sparks meme fest over bizarre speedboat scene on F1 trackThe trailer of 'War 2' has sparked a wave of amusement and criticism online, especially for a surreal scene featuring a speedboat on a Formula 1 racetrack. The highly-anticipated trailer was released on July 25.

Matt Shakman, Vanessa Kirby, Pedro Pascal on rebooting Fantastic FourMarvel Studios introduces The Fantastic Four: First Steps, a fresh take on the iconic superhero family set in an alternate 1960s universe. The film combines cosmic adventure with heartfelt themes of parenthood and vulnerability.

War 2 trailer review: Style, swag and jarring bikini moment in Hrithik-Jr NTR's film'War 2' looks unbelievably stylish, and packed with swag. But is that all? Are we getting another spy film that glorifies that one saviour of the country? And more importantly, what is an Indian Air Force officer doing in a bikini?

general news.headline: From 'India Out' to most trusted friend: PM, Maldives' Muizzu recalibrate tiesDuring his visit to the Maldives, Prime Minister Narendra Modi reaffirmed the deep historical and strategic ties between the two nations, announced a Rs 4,850 crore credit line, and held wide-ranging talks with President Mohamed Muizzu.

It was my mistake: Rahul Gandhi admits failure in understanding OBC plightReflecting on his 21-year political career, Rahul Gandhi said he had done justice to several issues, including the land acquisition bill, MGNREGA, the food bill, and the rights of tribal communities.

Students raised alarm before Rajasthan school roof caved in: Teachers scolded usThe teachers were allegedly having breakfast outside the area where the roof of the school in Rajasthan collapsed — the same place where students had gathered for the morning assembly.

Udaipur college on boil after student dies by suicide alleging 'torture' by staffA handwritten note found at the location accuses staff members of the college of harassment, citing irregularities in exam schedules, arbitrary failure of students, and repeated monetary demands.

Power, pollution, politics: The great hypocrisy of India's VIP cavalcadeIndia's political and administrative leaders routinely travel in massive, fuel-hungry cavalcades — fleets whose carbon footprints are far larger than they appear in passing. The cavalcades in Indian are seen as a symbol of power, reach and position.

Infiltrators won't be allowed...: Chirag Paswan backs Bihar voter roll clean-upChirag Paswan, Union Minister, criticises Opposition's stand on Bihar voter list revision. He emphasises the necessity of the process and dismisses concerns of injustice, urging the opposition to support the Election Commission's efforts.

Trump says Hamas wants to die, urges Israel to 'finish the job' in GazaCalling Hamas unwilling to negotiate, President Trump urged Israel to "clean it up" in Gaza and "finish the job," after US-brokered truce talks broke down and hostilities resumed.

Revamp tensions in BJP-RSS: Why the Sangh stamp is all overThe RSS is no longer content playing second fiddle. It is not just shaping state appointments in the BJP but also the central leadership transition

From Kargil to Operation Sindoor: Two decades of military transformation in IndiaWhile the valour, courage and determination of the Indian Armed Forces remain the same, in terms of technology and warfare, the Indian Military has come a long way from Operation Vijay to Operation Sindoor.

4th Test: Wheels come off for India in Manchester as Joe Root rewrites recordsEngland vs India, 4th Test: India conceded 319 runs as England seized control on Day 3 in Manchester. Joe Root scored a commanding 150, climbing to second place on the all-time list of Test run-scorers and leading what could be a series-defining batting charge for the hosts.

Not a shareholder, no coercion: Sunjay Kapur's firm counters mother's chargesThe clarification comes after it was reported that Rani Kapur had written a letter to delay the AGM and alleged that she was made to sign documents shortly after her son's death.

Rubio praises Pak's 'partnership in countering terrorism' after meeting Ishaq DarUS Secretary of State Marco Rubio met Pakistan's Ishaq Dar in Washington, praised counterterrorism cooperation, discussed trade and regional security, days after announcing sanctions on Pakistan-linked terror group TRF.
Prada turns devil again? Now, it's juttis after KolhapurisJutti-inspired much? Prada's 'Antiqued Leather Pumps' spark another row.

Ireland not safe: Indian man's viral post after attack on Amazon employeeAn Indian man's post goes viral after a racist stabbing of an Amazon employee in Ireland, where he warned the country is no longer safe and advised others not to move there.

Saiyaara box office Day 8: Mohit Suri film continues strong run, earns Rs 190 croreMohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' has been earning tremendous love from all quarters. The movie, starring debutant Ahaan Panday alongside Aneet Padda, earned Rs 190 crore in just eight days.

Alerts issued across Maharashtra as heavy rain disrupts life, schools shutA red alert has been issued for Palghar and the ghat areas of Pune, while an orange alert is in place for Mumbai, Raigad, Ratnagiri, Sindhudurg and the ghat regions of Nashik and Satara.

How an India-US spy mission lost a nuclear device in the HimalayasAfter China's first atomic test, the US and India, as part of a covert operation, tried to place a nuclear-powered listening device at 25,000 feet in the Himalayas near the Nanda Devi peak. A blizzard forced the CIA-IB team to leave the device on the route. A recovery mission, and several search operations, failed to locate the device.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Cambodia urges 'immediate ceasefire' as border clashes with Thailand escalateDeadly border clashes between Cambodia and Thailand triggered UN talks, with over 138,000 people evacuated and rising casualties in their ongoing territorial dispute.

Humpy vs Deshmukh: All you need to know about Chess World Cup finalKoneru Humpy and Divya Deshmukh are set to face each other in the all-India final at the Chess World Cup final, starting Saturday, July 26. While Humpy beat Tingjie Lei in the semis, Deshmukh got the better of Zhongyi Tan.

What's ailing Jasprit Bumrah? Manchester misfire raises red flagsENG vs IND, 4th Test: While some of the biggest batters were allowed to fail for long periods, the scrutiny on Bumrah's wicket column has been immense. Day 3 in Manchester was again a stark reminder of the fact that he isn't the magic wand that can make up for the tactical blunders of the team.

Bihar woman raped by 2 in moving ambulance after she fainted in Home Guard examThe incident occurred on July 24, after the woman fainted during a race and was rushed to a hospital in an ambulance stationed at the site.

Manchester Test: India concede 500 overseas for the first time in 10 yearsThe Indian bowlers were made to toil on Day 3 of the Manchester Test as they conceded 500 runs. This was the first time in 10 years that India conceded 500-plus in an innings in an overseas Test.

Don't need your permission: Mahayuti ministers' letter war over meetingsA fresh row between BJP's Madhuri Misal and Shiv Sena's Sanjay Shirsat over departmental meetings has reignited tensions within Maharashtra's ruling Mahayuti coalition.

Fantastic Four box office Day 1: Marvel film earns Rs 5 crore amid Saiyaara crazeMarvel Studios' 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' opened modestly in India, earning Rs 5.10 crore on its first day, facing stiff competition from the Bollywood hit 'Saiyaara'.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu box office Day 2: Pawan Kalyan's film sees a huge dipPawan Kalyan's 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' saw a sharp decline at the box office on its second day, earning Rs 8 crore after an impressive Rs 47.50 crore opening.

sports.headline: Tim David's historic century powers Australia to T20I series win vs West IndiesWI vs AUS, 3rd T20I: Tim David hit Australia's fastest hundred in T20Is off 37 balls as the visitors sealed the five-match series with a dominating six-wicket win at the Warner Park in Basseterre, St Kitts.

Morkel also admitted that the Indian pacers were lacking a bit of energy that was needed on the flat Manchester pitch.

Bengaluru stadium, set to host Women's World Cup matches, deemed unsafe: ReportThe M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru has been declared unsafe for large-scale events following a judicial commission report. The iconic venue is slated to host crucial matches in the upcoming Women's World Cup, scheduled for September-October.

China Open: Satwik-Chirag storm into semis, Unnati Hooda's dream run endsSatwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty advanced to the China Open semifinals with a win over Malaysia. Young Indian player Unnati Hooda's impressive run ended after losing to world number four Akane Yamaguchi.

Squash: Teenager Anahat Singh clinches bronze at World Junior ChampionshipsTeen squash sensation Anahat Singh secured a bronze medal at the World Squash Junior Championships. She became the first Indian girl since 2010 to reach the last-four stage in the tournament.

Joe Root goes past Ponting, only behind Tendulkar in all-time Test listJoe Root moved to second place in the all-time Test run-scorers list during the Manchester Test. His achievement highlights his consistency and raises expectations of surpassing Sachin Tendulkar.

Is captain Shubman Gill to blame for India's bowling flop show? Experts dividedEngland dominated India on Day 3 of the fourth Test at Old Trafford, exposing weaknesses in India's bowling attack. Questions arise over Shubman Gill's captaincy and the team's reluctance to use key spinners early in the innings.

Khalid Jamil emerges as frontrunner for Indian football team coach roleKhalid Jamil is the frontrunner for the vacant Indian men's football coach role. AIFF will announce the decision after an executive committee meeting within 10 days.

SA U-19 opener beats Vaibhav Suryavanshi to first-ever 200 in a Youth ODISouth Africa's Jorich van Schalkwyk beat Vaibhav Suryavanshi to be the first person to score a double hundred in a Youth ODI match.

India batter Veda Krishnamurthy announces retirement from professional cricketIndia batter Veda Krishnamurthy announced her retirement from professional cricket on Friday, July 25. Krishnamurthy was known for her explosive batting in the middle-order and was part of India's 2017 World Cup squad.

Shaheen Afridi makes T20I return as Pakistan announce West Indies tour squadsShaheen Shah Afridi has made a return to the T20I side as Pakistan announced their squads for the upcoming tour of the West Indies. Pakistan will play 3 ODIs and 3 T20Is against West Indies, starting on July 31.

Abhishek Nayar named UP Warriorz head coach for WPL season 4Abhishek Nayar has been named head coach of UP Warriorz ahead of the WPL season 4. His appointment aims to strengthen the team and nurture domestic talent for a title challenge.

Arsenal reach full agreement for Viktor Gyokeres, set to take iconic No.14: ReportArsenal have reportedly had a final agreement with Sporting CP regarding the transfer of Viktor Gyokeres. He is set to switch to the London-based club and even don the iconic No.14 shirt as well.

Joe Root surpasses Rahul Dravid to become third-highest run-scorer in Test cricketEngland vs India: Joe Root went past Jacques Kallis and Rahul Dravid on the all-time Tests scorers list when he went past 30 on Day 3 of the Manchester Test. Root is now only behind Sachin Tendulkar and Ricky Ponting on the elite list.

Shaheen Afridi makes T20I return as Pakistan announce West Indies tour squadsShaheen Shah Afridi has made a return to the T20I side as Pakistan announced their squads for the upcoming tour of the West Indies. Pakistan will play 3 ODIs and 3 T20Is against West Indies, starting on July 31.

Root is now only behind Sachin Tendulkar and Ricky Ponting on the elite list.

Cricket has changed quite a bit: Bhuvneshwar weighs in on Dukes ball debateBhuvneshwar Kumar suggested that multiple factors could be in play for the Dukes ball to not provide the expected levels of movement in the ongoing Test series between England and India.

Rishabh Pant is someone who can lead India in the future: Hemang BadaniENG vs IND: Hemang Badani said that Rishabh Pant has excellent leadership qualities and can be India's captain in the future. Pant conjured cheers from the cricket fraternity for batting with a broken toe on the second day at Old Trafford.

England trying to win, not be entertainers: Steve Smith sees evolution in BazballSteve Smith reckons that England may have evolved from trying to entertain the crowd to winning games as seen in the ongoing Test series against India.

4th Test Day 3 Highlights: Stokes, Dawson see-off England to stumpsIndia (IND) vs England (ENG), 4th Test, Day 3 Live Score and Updates: England finish Day 3 in a dominating position on 544/7 leading India by 186 runs. India managed to take some wickets late in the day but it was all too late. It's up to their batters now to save the match for them on the last two days.

Shubman's decision to give Kamboj new ball highly debatable: AshwinENG vs IND: Ravichandran Ashwin has backed Indian skipper Shubman Gill's decision to hand the new ball to Anshul Kamboj, citing the debutant's skillset and expressing hope that the youngster will take wickets on Day 3 of the Manchester Test.

DC Open: Raducanu dominates Osaka, Venus Williams defeated in pre-quartersEmma Raducanu cruised past Naomi Osaka 6-4, 6-2 to reach the Washington Open quarter-finals and reclaim the British No. 1 spot. Venus Williams' comeback ended with a straight-sets loss to Magdalena Frech.

Pant wasn't even able to walk: Chopra hails batter's unbreakable spiritENG vs IND, 4th Test: Rishabh Pant showed incredible courage by batting with a fractured toe during the fourth Test against England. Former cricketer Aakash Chopra praised his spirit, calling it inspiring and unforgettable.

Need that Virat Kohli mentality: Gill urged to lead India's series comebackENG vs IND: Michael Vaughan feels that Shubman Gill and Co need to channel in that Virat Kohli mentality to lead a fightback on Day 3 of the Manchester Test.

Not one backup middle-order batter: Chopra questions India's squad balanceENG vs IND, 4th Test: Aakash Chopra raised concerns about India's lack of middle-order depth after Day 2 of the fourth Test. While the visitors struggled with their batting balance, Ben Stokes and Jofra Archer's standout performances helped keep England in the game with a disciplined effort.

Just not cricket: Should Stokes and Archer have attacked Pant's broken toe?ENG vs IND, 4th Test: Rishabh Pant sustained a toe injury on Day 1 at Old Trafford, but the left-handed batter returned to score a gutsy half-century on the second day, helping India put up a score of 358 on the board.

If Rishabh Pant's bravery doesn't lift India, nothing will: Ravi ShastriENG vs IND, 4th Test: Rishabh Pant showed grit and came out to bat in Manchester despite a toe injury. He scored 54 runs and helped India put up 358 on the board in the first innings.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
